isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ 5 Engine Service Manual - Oil Cooler and Filter Housing - Removal

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.
To prevent personal injury or death, shift transmission to park or neutral, set parking brake, and block wheels before doing diagnostic or service procedures.
To prevent personal injury or death, allow engine to cool before removing components.
To prevent personal injury or death, wear safety glasses with side shields. Limit compressed air pressure to 207 kPa (30 psi).

To prevent personal injury or death, do not let engine fluids stay on your skin. Clean skin and nails using hand cleaner, and wash with soap and water. Wash or discard clothing and rags contaminated with engine fluids.

regulation.para: Engine fluids (oil, fuel, and coolant) may be a threat to the environment. Recycle or dispose of engine fluids and filters according to applicable regulations. Never put engine fluids in the trash, on the ground, in sewers or bodies of water.

step1.para: Remove the air intake duct and turbocharger oil supply tube assembly. See "Dual Stage Turbocharger Assembly".
Remove the secondary fuel filter assembly. See "Fuel Systems".
Loosen oil filter cap and allow oil to drain through filter housing.
Remove the oil filter cap and oil filter. Discard O-ring gasket on cap.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not remove latching return tube unless oil filter housing and oil filter base have been separated.

step1.para: Remove M8 x 55 bolt securing the oil filter housing assembly to the oil filter adapter.
Remove the two M8 x 50 x 16 stud bolts securing the oil filter housing to the intake manifold.
Pull up and remove oil filter housing assembly from engine. Discard O-rings.
Remove six M6 x 25 screws securing the oil filter housing to the oil filter base. Remove and discard oil filter assembly gasket.
Remove the oil filter latching return tube by pushing down and rotating tube counter-clockwise 120°, then lift tube straight up. Remove O-ring seal and discard.
